name: Malaria
description: A mosquito-borne infectious disease caused by Plasmodium parasites common in Nigeria.
causes: Plasmodium parasite transmitted through bites of infected Anopheles mosquitoes.
treatment: Antimalarial medications such as artemisinin-based combination therapies (ACTs).
homeRemedy: Stay hydrated, use fever reducers like paracetamol, sleep under insecticide-treated nets, and drink herbal teas like neem or lemongrass.

name: Typhoid Fever
description: A bacterial infection due to Salmonella typhi, often from contaminated food or water.
causes: Ingestion of food or water contaminated with Salmonella typhi.
treatment: Antibiotics like ciprofloxacin or azithromycin, hydration, and rest.
homeRemedy: Drink clean water mixed with salt and sugar (ORS), consume soft foods like pap, rest well, and use herbal bitters.

name: Hypertension
description: A condition in which the force of the blood against the artery walls is too high.
causes: Genetics, high salt intake, obesity, stress, lack of physical activity.
homeRemedy: Reduce salt intake, exercise regularly, eat more fruits and vegetables, and avoid stress.

name: Diabetes
description: A group of diseases that result in too much sugar in the blood (high blood glucose).
causes: Insulin resistance or lack of insulin production.
treatment: Insulin, oral hypoglycemics, diet control, and exercise.
homeRemedy: Monitor blood sugar levels, eat whole grains and bitter leaf soup, exercise daily, and drink plenty of water.

name: Diarrhea
description: Frequent loose, watery stools usually caused by infections or food intolerance.
causes: Contaminated food or water, viruses, bacteria, parasites.
treatment: Rehydration, ORS, and in some cases antibiotics.
homeRemedy: Use oral rehydration solution, eat cooked rice or ripe banana, and avoid oily or spicy food.

name: Tuberculosis
description: An infectious disease that mainly affects the lungs, common in densely populated Nigerian areas.
causes: Mycobacterium tuberculosis spread via airborne droplets.
treatment: Antibiotics taken for 6 months, including isoniazid and rifampicin.
homeRemedy: Eat garlic, ginger, turmeric, and bitter kola; ensure good ventilation and sunlight exposure.

name: Pneumonia
description: Inflammation of the lungs caused by infection.
causes: Bacteria, viruses, fungi; worsened by poor hygiene or untreated colds.
homeRemedy: Inhale steam with eucalyptus oil, drink warm ginger tea, and rest in a warm environment.

name: Asthma
description: A chronic respiratory condition that causes difficulty breathing.
causes: Genetics, allergens, air pollution, respiratory infections.
homeRemedy: Avoid cold weather, use warm steam therapy, and drink clove or honey-infused tea.

name: Conjunctivitis
description: Also known as Apollo, a common eye infection in Nigeria.
causes: Viral or bacterial infection, allergies, or irritants.
treatment: Antibiotic or antiviral eye drops, hygiene.
homeRemedy: Apply clean warm compress to eyes, rinse with clean water, and avoid sharing towels.

name: Measles
description: A contagious viral disease, preventable by vaccine.
causes: Measles virus spread via respiratory droplets.
homeRemedy: Use neem leaf baths, ensure fluid intake, and rest in a cool, clean environment.

name: Common Cold
description: A viral upper respiratory infection common during the rainy season.
causes: Viruses like rhinovirus spread through air or contact.
treatment: Rest, hydration, and over-the-counter cold medications.
homeRemedy: Drink warm lemon and honey tea, inhale steam, and rest well.

name: Ulcer
description: Sores in the stomach lining caused by H. pylori or excessive acid.
causes: H. pylori infection, NSAID use, stress.
treatment: Antibiotics, proton pump inhibitors, and antacids.
homeRemedy: Avoid spicy food, eat early dinners, consume cabbage juice or unripe plantain.

name: Hepatitis B
description: A viral liver infection that can become chronic.
causes: Hepatitis B virus spread through blood and bodily fluids.
homeRemedy: Avoid alcohol, eat fruits like pawpaw, and drink bitter leaf juice.

name: Toothache
description: Pain around a tooth due to decay or gum infection.
causes: Cavities, gum disease, cracked teeth.
homeRemedy: Rinse mouth with warm salt water, chew cloves, and avoid sugary food.

name: Skin Rashes
description: Inflammation or irritation of the skin, often caused by heat or allergens.
causes: Allergies, infections, poor hygiene, heat.
homeRemedy: Apply aloe vera or shea butter, bathe in neem water, and avoid harsh soaps.

name: Dysentery
description: An intestinal infection causing severe diarrhea with blood.
causes: Bacterial or amoebic infection via contaminated food or water.
homeRemedy: Drink ORS, consume unripe plantain flour paste, and rest.

name: Worm Infestation
description: Parasitic worms in the intestines affecting mostly children.
causes: Poor hygiene, contaminated water or food.
treatment: Anthelmintic drugs like albendazole or mebendazole.
homeRemedy: Eat raw pawpaw seeds, garlic, and maintain good hygiene.

name: Ringworm
description: Fungal skin infection commonly affecting children.
causes: Fungal spores from infected people or surfaces.
homeRemedy: Apply lime and salt mixture or black soap and palm kernel oil.

name: Scabies
description: Contagious skin infestation by mites.
causes: Sarcoptes scabiei mites, spread through close contact.
homeRemedy: Apply neem oil or soak in warm water with sulfur soap.

name: Food Poisoning
description: Illness from contaminated or spoiled food.
causes: Bacteria, viruses, or toxins in food.
treatment: Hydration, rest, antibiotics in severe cases.
homeRemedy: Drink ORS, rest, and take ginger or activated charcoal.

name: Urinary Tract Infection (UTI)
description: Infection in any part of the urinary system, often the bladder.
causes: Bacteria like E. coli from poor hygiene or unclean water.
homeRemedy: Drink cranberry juice, increase water intake, and maintain personal hygiene.

name: Migraine
description: A neurological condition causing intense headaches.
causes: Stress, lack of sleep, hormonal changes.
treatment: Pain relievers, rest, and avoiding triggers.
homeRemedy: Lie in a dark room, use a cold compress, and inhale peppermint oil.

name: Menstrual Cramps
description: Pain during menstruation due to uterine contractions.
causes: Hormonal changes and prostaglandin release.
homeRemedy: Use hot water bottles, drink ginger tea, and exercise lightly.

name: Sinusitis
description: Inflammation of the sinuses causing pain and congestion.
causes: Infections, allergies, or cold.
homeRemedy: Inhale steam with eucalyptus, drink hot water, and apply warm compress.

name: Sore Throat
description: Inflammation or infection of the throat.
causes: Viral infections, bacteria, dry air.
homeRemedy: Gargle warm salt water, suck honey and lemon, and drink warm fluids.

name: Eczema
description: A skin condition causing inflammation and irritation.
causes: Allergens, soaps, genetics.
homeRemedy: Apply coconut oil or shea butter, avoid harsh soaps, and keep skin hydrated.

name: Eye Strain
description: Discomfort after long use of eyes, especially screens.
causes: Extended screen time, poor lighting.
homeRemedy: Use 20-20-20 rule, blink more often, and apply warm compress.

name: Constipation
description: Difficulty in passing stool or infrequent bowel movements.
causes: Low fiber, dehydration, inactivity.
homeRemedy: Drink warm water, eat pawpaw, and consume high-fiber foods like okra.

name: Athlete's Foot
description: Fungal infection affecting the skin between toes.
causes: Fungal spores in damp environments.
homeRemedy: Soak feet in salt water or vinegar, keep feet dry, and use talcum powder.

name: Ear Infection
description: Infection of the middle or outer ear.
causes: Bacteria, viruses, or water exposure.
homeRemedy: Warm compress, garlic oil drops, and avoid inserting objects into the ear.

name: Gout
description: A form of arthritis characterized by sudden, severe pain in the joints.
causes: High levels of uric acid in the blood.
homeRemedy: Drink plenty of water, avoid alcohol, and consume cherries or ginger.

name: Angina Pectoris
description: Chest pain caused by reduced blood flow to the heart muscles.
causes: Coronary artery disease, stress, physical exertion.
homeRemedy: Practice relaxation techniques, avoid heavy meals, and engage in light exercise.
